Art. 4.239
Gift of the available portion 
If the surviving spouse, in concurrence with descendants, has received by gift or will the available portion in full ownership, this gift does not have the effect, unless otherwise provided by the donor or testator, of depriving him or her of his or her right of usufruct over the remainder of the succession.
In the event of concurrence with other heirs or legatees, the surviving spouse who has received gifts in full ownership retains the rights granted to him or her under Title 1 in respect of the remainder of the succession, unless the donor or testator provides otherwise.
If the donor or testator has expressly wished to limit the rights of the surviving spouse to the property donated or bequeathed, the surviving spouse may in any event claim the additional amount necessary to complete his or her reserve, where applicable on the basis of the capital value thereof.
